revised_title: Molecular Properties and Photoperception of Phytochrome
tldr: This article discusses the molecular properties of phytochrome, a photoreversible chromoprotein in plants that plays a crucial role in light-regulated processes. The study focuses on the molecular mass and spectral properties of phytochrome, as well as the phototransformation pathways from Pr to Pfr and vice versa. The research also highlights the importance of chromophore domain size and its impact on phytochrome's functionality.
